The table of sections for chapter 55 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 5537. SEC. 3. READY RESERVE-NATIONAL GUARD EMPLOYEE CREDIT ADDED TO GENERAL BUSINESS CREDIT. This section amends the Internal Revenue Code to add a new credit for Ready Reserve-National Guard employees. The effective date for the amendments made by this section is pay periods beginning on or after September 11, 2001. SEC. 45G. READY RESERVE-NATIONAL GUARD EMPLOYEE CREDIT. The Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit under section 38 is 50% of the actual compensation amount for the taxable year. The actual compensation amount is the compensation paid when the employee is absent for qualified active duty. The Ready Reserve-National Guard employee can receive a credit for 50% of their actual compensation when absent for qualified active duty, with a maximum time limit of 12 months. No credit is allowed for days not scheduled to work unless for qualified active duty. Qualified active duty is defined for this purpose. Qualified active duty, for the purpose of receiving credit for compensation when absent, refers to active duty excluding training duty specified in title 10 and title 32, entitling employees to reemployment rights.
